title.narrative: WASH OP 4 - SANITATION AND HYGIENE

description.narrative: All communities eradicate open defecation and the use of improved sanitation facilities in combination with appropriate hygiene practices is generalized., which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2020, households and communities have access to safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and good hygiene practices are equitably improved in target regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: All communities eradicate open defecation and the use of improved sanitation facilities in combination with appropriate hygienepractices is generalized.

description.narrative: This year has been challenging for the implementation of sanitation and hygiene activities, primarily due to a necessary shift in implementation partners followed by the impact of the COVID-19 epidemic - moving to a NGO-based implementation model. While targets for this year have not been met, evidence-based changes in programming approaches are expected to yield more sustainable results by the end of the CPD. Throughout this year, market-based approaches and engagement with the private sector have been built into our Output 4 programming, and are being tested for scale-up with the new CPD.; | Status:Not met | As-of Date:12/01/2021
